column7: plot

cabiria is a 1914 italian silent film directed by giovanni pastrone. the film follows the story of cabiria, a young girl who is kidnapped by an evil roman general. she is taken to carthage and sold into slavery. after escaping, she embarks on a journey of self-discovery and adventure. along the way, she meets a variety of characters including a mysterious prophet, a pirate captain, and an egyptian princess. through her experiences, cabiria learns about love, loyalty, and courage. in the end, she finds her true home and happiness with her family in rome. the film is

a man there was is a 1917 silent film directed by victor sjöström. it tells the story of a humble fisherman, thor, who is devoted to his family and his work. when thor's son is falsely accused of murder and sentenced to death, thor sets out on a quest to prove his son's innocence. along the way, he faces many obstacles and hardships, but never gives up hope. he eventually succeeds in freeing his son from prison and restoring his honor. the film is a powerful exploration of faith, justice, and the power of love in the face of adversity. it also serves as an important

the film j'accuse! (1919) is a french silent film directed by abel gance. it tells the story of jean diaz, a soldier in world war i who returns home to find his beloved fiancée, edith, has died. he discovers that she was killed by a shell fired by the germans and he is determined to seek justice for her death. he begins a campaign to bring attention to the plight of all those who have suffered in the war and to demand reparations from the german government. along the way, he meets other veterans who share his mission and together they form an army of ghosts

safety last! is a 1923 silent comedy film starring harold lloyd. the film follows the story of a young man, harold, who moves to the big city in search of a better life. he takes a job as a clerk in a department store and promises his sweetheart that he will make something of himself. in order to prove his worth, he decides to climb the outside of the store's building as part of an advertising stunt. as he climbs higher and higher, the police become involved and chaos ensues. along the way, harold must dodge obstacles such as birds, window washers, and even an angry bulldog.

the epic saga of die nibelungen: siegfried follows the titular hero, a fearless warrior who is determined to reclaim his birthright. after slaying a dragon and obtaining a magical ring, siegfried sets out on a quest to find the nibelungen hoard, an immense treasure hidden deep within the mountains. along the way, he must battle fierce monsters and powerful enemies in order to reach his goal. along the way, he meets kriemhild, a beautiful princess who falls in love with him. with her help, siegfried is able to defeat his enemies and reclaim the hoard. in the end

the seven chances is a 1925 silent comedy film directed by buster keaton. the story follows jimmie shannon, a young man who stands to inherit seven million dollars if he can marry before 7:00 pm on his 27th birthday. when jimmie learns of the stipulation, he sets out to find a bride in a desperate attempt to become wealthy. along the way, he encounters numerous obstacles and humorous situations as he attempts to win the heart of his true love. as time runs out, jimmie must make a decision between love and money. will he be able to find his true love in time or will he miss

pandora's box is a classic silent film from 1929, directed by g.w. pabst and starring louise brooks. the film follows the story of lulu, a young woman who is seduced by a series of men, each of whom brings her more trouble than the last. lulu's journey begins when she meets dr. schon, an older man who takes her in and introduces her to the world of high society. from there, she meets a variety of characters including a wealthy businessman, an aristocrat, and a criminal underworld figure. as lulu moves through these different worlds, she finds herself in

the docks of new york is a 1928 silent film directed by josef von sternberg. the film follows bill, a sailor who has just returned from a long voyage. after a night of drinking and gambling, he meets mae, a young woman who works as a dancer in the local bar. despite their differences, they quickly fall in love and plan to marry. however, bill's past catches up with him when he discovers that his former shipmate is now the leader of a gang of criminals. with his newfound knowledge, bill must decide whether to stay with mae or join the gang and risk his life for money. as

steamboat bill, jr. is a 1928 silent comedy film starring buster keaton. the story follows william canfield jr., the son of a riverboat captain, who comes to visit his father in a small mississippi town. his father, steamboat bill, is in competition with a rival steamboat captain and is determined to win the race. meanwhile, william jr. falls in love with the daughter of his father's rival and must find a way to win her heart while also helping his father win the race. along the way, he faces numerous obstacles including an impending hurricane and a jailbreak. in the end, william jr

the woman in the moon is a 1929 german science fiction silent film directed by fritz lang. it follows the story of professor manfeldt, a scientist who discovers a new element that could be used to fuel rockets. he and his assistant, friede, set out on an expedition to the moon in order to find more of this element. along the way they encounter a mysterious woman who seems to have some kind of connection with the moon. they eventually make it to the moon and discover an underground civilization living there. the inhabitants are hostile towards them and they must fight for their lives as they search for the element they need. as

le million is a 1931 french musical comedy film directed by rené clair. the film follows the story of michel, a struggling artist who is desperately in love with his neighbor, paulette. when michel discovers that paulette's father has won a million francs in the lottery, he hatches a plan to win her heart. he borrows money from his friend and enters the lottery himself, hoping to win enough money to marry paulette. unfortunately, he only wins one ticket and must find a way to get it back from the thief who stole it. with the help of his friends, michel embarks on an exciting adventure

the miracle woman is a 1931 drama film directed by frank capra. the film stars barbara stanwyck as florence fallon, a young woman who uses her faith and cunning to help the downtrodden. after her father dies, florence is left with nothing but her faith and determination. she begins to preach in the streets, gaining a large following of people who are inspired by her words. she soon finds herself in the middle of a political battle between two powerful men, one of whom wants to use her for his own gain. with the help of her newfound friends, florence must find a way to use her faith and strength to

randy bowers (john wayne) is a drifter who rides into a small town in the old west. he soon finds himself in the middle of a feud between two rival gangs, led by the notorious outlaws, bart and jim. when randy is accused of being part of the gang, he must prove his innocence and bring justice to the town. with the help of an old prospector, randy sets out to find evidence that will clear his name and bring peace to the town. along the way, he faces danger from both sides of the law as he battles his way through gunfights and fistfights. in the

les misérables is a 1935 french drama film directed by raymond bernard. it tells the story of jean valjean, a former convict who is released from prison after serving 19 years for stealing a loaf of bread. after his release, valjean struggles to find work and is constantly harassed by police inspector javert, who is determined to bring him back to prison. valjean eventually finds work as a factory owner and adopts an orphaned girl named cosette. when javert discovers valjean's true identity, he pursues him relentlessly. valjean must flee with cosette and seek refuge in paris

the lower depths is a 1936 film directed by jean renoir. it tells the story of a group of people living in a dilapidated boarding house in 19th century russia. the inhabitants are all from different walks of life, including a former nobleman, an ex-convict, and a prostitute. despite their differences, they form an unlikely bond as they struggle to survive in their impoverished environment. the film follows the characters as they grapple with poverty, alcoholism, and despair. as tensions rise between them, they must find ways to cope with their difficult circumstances and ultimately come together to help each other out. in the end

the they were five is a 1936 french drama film directed by julien duvivier. the film follows the story of five young men who are struggling to make ends meet in paris during the great depression. the five friends, jean, jacques, françois, louis and paul, decide to pool their resources and open a small business together. despite their best efforts, the business fails and they are left with no money and no prospects. desperate for money, they decide to take part in a dangerous heist that could potentially make them rich. however, things don't go as planned and the five friends find themselves in a desperate

the sisters of the gion is a 1936 japanese drama film directed by kenji mizoguchi. it follows the story of two sisters, omocha and umekichi, who live in the gion district of kyoto. omocha is a geisha and umekichi works as a maid in a teahouse. the sisters are very close and rely on each other for support. however, their relationship is tested when omocha falls in love with a wealthy patron of the teahouse. despite her sister's disapproval, omocha pursues her relationship with him, leading to a series of events that

the 1936 film rembrandt tells the story of the life and work of the famous dutch painter, rembrandt van rijn. the film follows his life from his early days as a struggling artist in leiden to his later years as a renowned painter in amsterdam. it chronicles his successes and failures, his relationships with patrons and colleagues, and his struggles with poverty. along the way, we get to see some of rembrandt's most famous works, including the night watch and the anatomy lesson of dr. nicolaes tulp. we also get to witness some of the most important events in dutch history during

the story of louis pasteur is a 1936 biographical drama film about the life of french chemist and microbiologist louis pasteur. the film follows pasteur's life from his early days as a professor at the university of strasbourg to his later years as a renowned scientist. it begins with pasteur's discovery of the germ theory of disease, which revolutionized medical science and saved countless lives. he then goes on to develop vaccines for rabies, anthrax, and chicken cholera. despite facing opposition from the medical establishment, pasteur perseveres and eventually wins recognition for his work. the film culminates with

the confession is a 1937 drama film directed by joe may. it stars kay francis as a woman who is falsely accused of murder and must prove her innocence. the story begins with the mysterious death of a wealthy man, and his daughter, anna (francis), is the prime suspect. she is arrested and put on trial for the crime, but she refuses to confess to something she did not do. with the help of her lawyer, she sets out to prove her innocence by uncovering the truth behind her father's death. along the way, she discovers secrets about her family's past that could help clear her name. with

marked woman is a 1937 crime drama starring bette davis as mary dwight, a nightclub hostess who is caught in the middle of a mob war. after witnessing a murder, mary is marked for death by the mob boss, but she refuses to cooperate with them. with the help of an attorney, she decides to testify against the mob boss and his associates in court. as she prepares to take the stand, mary faces threats from all sides and must rely on her courage and strength to survive. along the way, she finds unexpected allies in her fight against corruption and injustice. in the end, mary's bravery helps bring down

the dawn patrol is a 1930s war drama about two british pilots, courtney and scott, who are assigned to the same squadron in france during world war i. the two men quickly become close friends and rely on each other for support as they face the horrors of war. as their squadron is sent on increasingly dangerous missions, courtney and scott must find a way to survive while still maintaining their friendship. along the way, they must also deal with the harsh realities of life in the trenches, including death, injury, and psychological trauma. as their friendship deepens, courtney and scott come to understand that courage and loyalty are more important than

jezebel is a 1938 american romantic drama film starring bette davis and henry fonda. the film tells the story of julie marsden, a strong-willed southern belle living in new orleans during the antebellum period. after being jilted by her fiancé preston dillard, julie defies convention by wearing a red dress to the olympus ball, an event that is considered scandalous in her society. her actions cause a rift between her and preston, as well as with her family and friends. as julie's reputation is ruined, she must find a way to redeem herself and win back preston's

charlie chan is a detective who is sent to investigate a mysterious murder on treasure island. he meets with the island's eccentric inhabitants, including the mysterious dr. zodiac and his daughter, luana. as charlie investigates, he discovers that the island is home to a secret society of criminals and smugglers. with the help of his assistant, number two son, charlie must unravel the mystery before it's too late. along the way, he encounters danger and intrigue as he uncovers clues that lead him closer to solving the case. as time runs out, charlie must use all of his wits and skills to save himself and those

column3: the private lives of elizabeth and essex
column7: the private lives of elizabeth and essex is a 1939 romantic drama set in the 16th century. it follows the story of queen elizabeth i and her love affair with robert devereux, the earl of essex. the two have a passionate relationship, but their love is forbidden due to their social status. despite this, they continue to meet in secret and share intimate moments together. as their relationship progresses, it becomes increasingly difficult for them to keep it hidden from the public eye. eventually, their affair is discovered and essex is arrested for treason. elizabeth must make a difficult decision between her love for essex and her duty as queen of england

the ape is a 1940 horror film about a mad scientist who creates a half-man, half-ape creature. the scientist, dr. bernard adrian, is obsessed with creating life and has been experimenting on apes for years. he finally succeeds in creating a creature that looks like a man but has the strength and agility of an ape. the creature escapes from the laboratory and terrorizes the town, killing anyone who gets in its way. as the townspeople try to hunt down the creature, they discover that it is intelligent and can communicate with them. they also discover that it has feelings and emotions, making it even more

the bank dick is a 1940 comedy film starring w.c. fields as egbert souse, an unemployed and often drunk man who is hired as a bank guard. after foiling a robbery attempt, he is promoted to bank detective and given the task of catching a gang of counterfeiters. along the way, he encounters various characters including his daughter's fiancé, an old friend, and a movie producer. despite his bumbling nature, egbert manages to outwit the criminals and save the day. the film is filled with slapstick humor and witty dialogue that make it an enjoyable classic comedy. in the end, eg

the grapes of wrath is a classic american drama film directed by john ford. it follows the joad family, a poor family from oklahoma, as they travel to california in search of a better life. along the way, they face many hardships and struggles, including poverty, hunger, and discrimination. despite these obstacles, the joads remain determined to make it to california and find a better life. the film follows their journey as they encounter various characters and situations that test their strength and courage. along the way, they learn valuable lessons about perseverance and hope in the face of adversity. in the end, the j

dumbo is a 1941 animated film about a young elephant with oversized ears. after being ridiculed by the other animals, dumbo is befriended by timothy q. mouse, who helps him gain confidence. with timothy's help, dumbo discovers that his large ears allow him to fly. he soon becomes a sensation at the circus and is reunited with his mother. however, the circus owner plans to exploit dumbo for financial gain and it's up to timothy and dumbo to save the day. along the way they encounter a group of crows who teach them how to use dumbo's unique abilities to their advantage. in the

aniki bóbó is a 1942 portuguese film directed by manoel de oliveira. it tells the story of two brothers, joão and josé, who live in a small village in portugal. the brothers are very close and share a special bond, but their lives are disrupted when joão is drafted into the military to fight in world war ii. josé is left alone and must find ways to cope with his brother's absence. he finds solace in the company of his friend aniki bóbó, an old man who lives nearby. together they explore the countryside and discover the beauty of nature. as

there was a father is a 1942 japanese drama film directed by yasujirō ozu. the film follows the story of shukichi, a widowed schoolteacher who lives with his daughter, setsuko. despite his love for her, shukichi is determined to give setsuko the best education possible and decides to send her away to tokyo for further studies. as setsuko grows up and becomes more independent, shukichi finds himself increasingly alone and isolated. he eventually decides to leave his job and move to tokyo in order to be closer to his daughter. despite their differences, the two develop a strong bond as

the palm beach story is a 1942 romantic comedy directed by preston sturges. it follows the story of tom and gerry jeffers, a married couple who are struggling financially. when gerry decides to leave tom and seek her fortune in palm beach, florida, tom follows her there. along the way, they meet a variety of eccentric characters, including a wealthy playboy and an eccentric millionaire. when they arrive in palm beach, gerry meets the playboy and falls for him, while tom meets the millionaire and strikes up an unlikely friendship. as their paths cross and intertwine, they all learn valuable lessons about love, money, and life

yankee doodle dandy is a 1942 musical biopic of the life of george m. cohan, one of america's most beloved entertainers. the film follows cohan's rise from a vaudeville performer to a broadway star and his eventual induction into the army during world war i. along the way, he meets and falls in love with mary, an aspiring actress, and together they create some of the most iconic songs in american history. the film features some of cohan's most famous songs such as "give my regards to broadway," "you're a grand old flag," and "over there." as

so proudly we hail! is a 1943 war drama film directed by mark sandrich. the film follows three nurses, played by claudette colbert, paulette goddard and veronica lake, who are sent to the philippines during world war ii. the nurses must face the harsh realities of war as they struggle to care for wounded soldiers and maintain their own sanity in the face of danger. as they battle against the enemy, they also must battle their own inner demons as they come to terms with their own mortality. along the way, they form a bond that will last them through the war and beyond. through their courage and determination, these

the punch bowl is a 1944 romantic comedy set in the english countryside. the story follows the lives of two young lovers, john and mary, who are separated by their families. john is a wealthy aristocrat and mary is a poor farmer's daughter. despite their differences, they are deeply in love and determined to be together.  john's father disapproves of their relationship and arranges for him to marry another woman. in order to prevent this from happening, mary hatches a plan to steal an expensive punch bowl from john's family estate. she enlists the help of her friends and together they manage to pull off the

the lodger is a 1944 british thriller film directed by john brahm. it follows the story of a mysterious lodger, mr. slade, who moves into a london boarding house owned by the buntings. mrs. bunting is suspicious of slade and believes he may be jack the ripper, the notorious serial killer who has been terrorizing london for months. she enlists her son, daisy, to investigate slade's background and find out if he is indeed the killer. meanwhile, slade begins to develop feelings for daisy and she for him. as their relationship grows, so does mrs. bunting

mr. skeffington is a 1944 romantic drama starring bette davis and claude rains. the film follows the life of fanny trellis, a beautiful and wealthy socialite living in new york city. she meets and falls in love with the charming but penniless stockbroker, job skeffington. despite their differences in social status, they marry and have a daughter together. however, fanny's vanity and selfishness soon drive job away, leaving her alone to raise their daughter. years later, when world war ii breaks out, job returns to new york to find fanny has become an alcoholic and their

mrs. parkington is a 1944 drama film starring greer garson and walter pidgeon. the film follows the life of susie parkington, a wealthy matriarch who has lived through the tumultuous changes of the 20th century. as she looks back on her life, she reflects on her humble beginnings as a servant in a small mining town, her marriage to an ambitious banker, and her rise to become one of the most powerful women in america. along the way, she faces difficult decisions about love and loyalty as she navigates the changing social landscape of the early 20th century. through it all, mrs.

the white cliffs of dover is a 1944 american drama film directed by clarence brown and starring irene dunne, alan marshal, and frank morgan. the film follows the story of a young englishwoman, alice (dunne), who falls in love with an american soldier (marshal) during world war ii. as the war progresses, alice and her family must face the harsh realities of life on the home front. through her struggles, alice finds strength in her faith and courage to carry on despite the hardships she faces. as she and her family endure the war, they come to understand that love can conquer all. the white

it's christmas 1945 in connecticut and the small town of bedford falls is bustling with holiday cheer. the bailey family is preparing for their annual christmas celebration, but this year is different. world war ii has just ended and the family is still reeling from the loss of their eldest son, george, who died in battle. despite their grief, they are determined to make this a special christmas for everyone.  the baileys invite their friends and neighbors to join them for a festive dinner and caroling around the tree. as they exchange gifts and stories, they remember george's sacrifice and honor his memory with a moment of silence.

dead of night is a 1945 british horror anthology film directed by alberto cavalcanti, charles crichton, basil dearden and robert hamer. it follows five strangers who are invited to a country house for the weekend. upon their arrival, they soon discover that the house is haunted by supernatural forces. as the night progresses, each of the guests tell their own terrifying tales of ghosts, vampires and other supernatural creatures. the stories become increasingly more frightening as the night wears on and the guests become more aware of the presence of evil in the house. as dawn approaches, they must confront their fears and find a way to survive until

the valley of decision is a 1945 drama set in the early 1900s. it follows the story of mary rafferty, a young irish immigrant who moves to pittsburgh with her family. she quickly falls in love with a wealthy steel magnate, stephen ormsby, and they plan to marry. however, their plans are complicated when mary's father discovers that stephen is actually the son of his former employer, whom he had a falling out with years ago. mary must choose between her love for stephen and her loyalty to her family. as tensions rise between the two families, mary must make a difficult decision that will shape her future

the she-wolf of london is a 1946 horror film about a young woman named june talbot who is cursed with lycanthropy. after her fiancé, larry, is attacked by a werewolf, june begins to suspect that she may be the creature responsible. she visits an old gypsy woman who confirms her fears and tells her that she must find the werewolf's lair in order to break the curse. with the help of larry and his friend paul, june embarks on a dangerous journey to find the werewolf's lair and save herself from becoming a monster. along the way, they encounter strange creatures and mysterious

sister kenny is a 1946 biographical drama film about the life of australian nurse elizabeth kenny. the film follows kenny's journey from rural australia to the united states, where she developed her revolutionary treatment for polio. despite facing opposition from the medical establishment, kenny perseveres and eventually gains recognition for her work. the film stars rosalind russell as sister kenny and alexander knox as dr. robert lovett, a doctor who supports her work.  the story begins in rural australia in 1911, where elizabeth kenny is working as a bush nurse. she develops an innovative treatment for polio that involves massaging the affected muscles and

no regrets for our youth is a 1946 japanese drama film directed by akira kurosawa. the film follows the story of yukie, a young woman living in a small village in japan during world war ii. her father, a professor, is arrested and accused of being a communist sympathizer. despite her family's protests, yukie decides to take up her father's cause and joins the student movement against the war. she meets and falls in love with noge, an idealistic student leader who shares her beliefs. together they fight for their ideals and face the consequences of their actions. as the war progresses, yukie

the web is a 1947 crime drama film directed by michael gordon. it stars edmond o'brien and ella raines as a married couple who become embroiled in a web of intrigue and murder.  the story begins when the couple, john and mary, move into an old apartment building in new york city. they soon discover that their new neighbors are involved in some shady dealings. john decides to investigate further and discovers that the building is owned by a powerful mob boss, mr. bigelow.  john's investigation leads him to uncover a complex web of corruption involving bigelow and his associates. he also

fort apache is a 1948 american western film directed by john ford and starring john wayne, henry fonda, shirley temple, and ward bond. the film follows the story of captain kirby york (john wayne), a veteran of the civil war who is assigned to command fort apache, an isolated military outpost in the arizona territory. york must contend with his new commanding officer, colonel owen thursday (henry fonda), who is determined to make a name for himself by leading his troops into battle against the apache indians. as tensions between the soldiers and the indians escalate, york must find a way to keep his men safe while also protecting the rights

the 1948 version of macbeth is a classic adaptation of william shakespeare's tragedy. the film follows the story of macbeth, a scottish general who is driven by ambition and greed to murder his king and take the throne for himself. after being encouraged by his wife, lady macbeth, he murders king duncan and takes the throne. however, his guilt and paranoia soon lead him to further acts of violence as he attempts to protect his power. as macbeth's reign continues, he becomes increasingly paranoid and desperate to keep his power. he is eventually overthrown by macduff, a nobleman who has been

pinky is a 1949 drama film directed by elia kazan and starring jeanne crain, ethel barrymore, and ethel waters. the story follows pinky johnson, a young african-american woman who passes for white in order to attend nursing school in the south. despite her success, she is forced to confront the racism of her peers and the harsh realities of segregation. after being rejected by her white classmates, pinky returns home to mississippi where she is welcomed with open arms by her grandmother and other members of the black community. she soon finds herself torn between two worlds as she struggles to reconcile her identity with the

the furies is a 1950 western film directed by anthony mann and starring barbara stanwyck, walter huston, and wendell corey. the story follows t.c. jeffords (huston), a wealthy rancher who has been feuding with his daughter, vance (stanwyck). when jeffords' son-in-law is killed in a gunfight, vance takes it upon herself to find the killer and bring him to justice. she teams up with an old friend, tom (corey), and together they set out on a dangerous journey across the desert in search of the murderer. along the way

the flight to mars is a thrilling 72-minute journey to the red planet. the story follows a group of astronauts as they embark on a daring mission to explore the unknown. led by their fearless commander, the crew must brave the dangers of space travel and face the unknown challenges that await them on mars. along the way, they encounter strange creatures, mysterious artifacts, and unexpected surprises. as they make their way closer to their destination, they must rely on each other and their courage to survive. with time running out, will they make it to mars in time? join them on this exciting adventure as they take flight into the unknown

superman and the mole-men is a 1951 american superhero film starring george reeves as superman and phyllis coates as lois lane. the film follows superman as he investigates strange occurrences in the small town of silsby, where a race of mole-like creatures have emerged from a nearby oil well. after saving the town from destruction, superman discovers that the mole-men are peaceful and just want to find a new home. with help from lois lane, superman helps the mole-men find a new home and protect them from those who would do them harm. in the end, superman is able to restore peace to sil

crip camp is a 2020 documentary film directed by nicole newnham and jim lebrecht. the film follows the story of a group of disabled teenagers who attended camp jened, a summer camp for disabled youth in the catskills in 1971. the campers, many of whom had never been away from home before, found freedom and acceptance at camp jened, and formed lifelong friendships. through archival footage and interviews with former campers, the film chronicles how their experiences at camp jened inspired them to become activists and fight for disability rights. the film follows the campers as they go on to become leaders
